trans-unit.source: Defines a structure that represents the style of a font face as normal, italic, or oblique.
Three terms categorize the slant of a font: normal, italic, and oblique.

|Font style|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |Normal|The characters in a normal, or roman, font are upright.| |Italic|The characters in an italic font are truly slanted and appear as they were designed.| |Oblique|The characters in an oblique font are artificially slanted.
The slant is achieved by performing a shear transformation on the characters from a normal font.

When a true italic font is not available on a computer or printer, an oblique style can generated from the normal font and used to simulate an italic font.| You can use the enumerated values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyles> class to set the FontStyle structure.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *fontStylesValue* A value, such as "Normal", "Italic", or "Oblique".
Compares an <xref:System.Object> with the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> instance for equality.
An <xref:System.Object> value that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare for equality.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to show the two instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compares a <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> with the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> instance for equality.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare for equality.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to show the two instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Retrieves the hash code for this object.
The returned value serves as a hash function for a particular type, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
A 32-bit hash code, which is a signed integer.
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to show the specified <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to determine inequality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
to show left is equal to right; otherwise, .
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.IFormattable.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref:System.String> specifying the format to use.
-or- <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref:System.IFormattable> implementation.
The <xref:System.IFormatProvider> to use to format the value.
-or- <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A <xref:System.String> containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.

Creates a <xref:System.String> that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> object and is based on the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture*> property information.
A <xref:System.String> that represents the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> object, such as "Normal", "Italic", or "Oblique".
